recipes.db_sqlserver::restore: Restores database from a local machine directory.
recipes.db_sqlserver::enable_sql_service: Enables the SQL Server service if disabled
recipes.db_sqlserver::default: Sets up default user and enables SQL service.
recipes.db_sqlserver::backup: Backs up database to a local machine directory.
recipes.db_sqlserver::import_dump_from_s3: Downloads SQL dump from S3 bucket and imports it into database.

long_description:
= DESCRIPTION:

SQL Server Recipes and Providers

= REQUIREMENTS:

Use on a RightImage which includes SQL Server (2005 or 2008, Express or Standard).

= USAGE:

Designed to be run within a RightScale ServerTemplate.
description: Microsoft SQL Server recipes and providers
name: db_sqlserver

s3/bucket_backups.description: The name of the S3 bucket. Ex: production-bucket-backup

s3/file_dump.description: Sql dump file to be retrieved from the s3 bucket. Ex: production-dump.sql or production-dump.sql.zip

db_sqlserver/backup/existing_backup_file.description: Wildcard file matching pattern (i.e. not a Regex) with Powershell-style string format arguments for finding backup files. The 0 argument represents the database name and the rest of the pattern should match the file names generated from the backup_file_name_format. Ex: {0}_*.bak

db_sqlserver/backup/backup_file_name_for.description: Format string with Powershell-style string format arguments for creating backup files. The 0 argument represents the database name and the 1 argument represents a generated time stamp. Ex: {0}_{1}.bak

db_sqlserver/server_name.description: The network name of the SQL Server instance used by recipes. Ex: 'localhost\SQLEXPRESS' for SQL EXPRESS or 'localhost' for SQL STANDARD

aws/access_key_id.description: This is an Amazon credential. Log in to your AWS account at aws.amazon.com to retrieve you access identifiers. Ex: 1JHQQ4KVEVM02KVEVM02

db_sqlserver/restore/force_restore.description: Whether to force restoring backup on top of any pre-existing database

aws/secret_access_key.description: This is an Amazon credential. Log in to your AWS account at aws.amazon.com to retrieve your access identifiers. Ex: XVdxPgOM4auGcMlPz61IZGotpr9LzzI07tT8s2Ws

db_sqlserver/database_name.description: SQL Server database(schema) name. Ex: production

db_sqlserver/backup/database_backup_dir.description: The local drive path or UNC path to the directory which will contain new SQL Server database backup (.bak) files. Note that network drives are not supported by SQL Server.

s3/bucket_dump.description: The name of the S3 bucket. Ex: production-bucket-dumps
